senses.de: To affect deeply or strongly in mind or feelings; influence in opinion.
senses.ex: She impressed us with her incredible skills.

Tips.title: Emotional Impact
Tips.description: Use 'impress' to describe someone making a strong, positive impact emotionally or mentally.
Tips.example: The poet's words impressed the audience deeply.

Tips.title: Not Just Visual
Tips.description: 'Impress' involves more than seeing; it's about a memorable or significant effect on someone.
Tips.example: Her commitment to charity work impressed everyone.

senses.de: To produce a mark, image, or design on a surface by pressure.
senses.ex: The artist impresses a design into the clay.

Tips.title: Physical Change
Tips.description: Use 'impress' when talking about creating a physical change or mark on a surface.
Tips.example: He impressed his initials into the wet cement.

Tips.title: Creative Expression
Tips.description: 'Impress' can express the act of artistic creation, like making a mark with tools or hands.
Tips.example: The jeweler impressed a pattern onto the locket.

senses.de: To transfer or apply a design or pattern onto a surface.
senses.ex: The printer impressed the ink onto the paper.

Tips.title: Technical Process
Tips.description: In a technical context, 'impress' is often used for the application of images or designs in printing.
Tips.example: The machine impresses codes onto the products.

Tips.title: Context-Specific
Tips.description: 'Impress' can be jargon in specialized fields, like printing, so recognize the field's influence on its meaning.
Tips.example: The press impresses text onto each page swiftly.

senses.de: To force into service, particularly in the army or navy.
senses.ex: Many civilians were impressed into the navy.

Tips.title: Historical Usage
Tips.description: Historically, 'impress' meant to forcefully enlist someone into military service, but it's not common now.
Tips.example: Sailors were often impressed to man the royal fleets.

Tips.title: Forced Service
Tips.description: 'Impress' in a military sense carries a connotation of compulsion and lack of choice.
Tips.example: The villagers were impressed into the king's army.

Amaze.wordDefinition:
Amaze means to surprise or astound someone greatly, often by doing something unexpected or difficult.

For example, if someone does an incredible magic trick that seems impossible, you could say you are amazed by their performance.

Astonish.wordDefinition:
Astonish means to surprise or shock someone with something unexpected or unbelievable.

It is often used to describe something that is amazing or unbelievable. For example, seeing a magician perform a trick might astonish you.

Both words are applicable in different situations. Astonish is used when something is unexpected or surprising, while impress is used when something is admirable or respectable.

Astound.wordDefinition:
Astound means to shock or surprise someone greatly, as if they can't believe what they are seeing or hearing.

Astound is used when something is surprising, while impress is used when something is admirable.

Awe.wordDefinition:
Awe is often used to describe a feeling of wonder or amazement. For example, you might feel awe when you see a breathtaking sunset or visit a grand cathedral.

Awe is usually reserved for things that are truly extraordinary and awe-inspiring.

Awe is for things that make you feel wonder and amazement, while impressions are more about forming opinions based on everyday experiences.

Dazzle.wordDefinition:
Dazzle means to astonish or amaze someone with something visually appealing or stunning. It's applicable when you want to describe something sparkling, shining or exceptionally beautiful.

To sum up, dazzle is more about creating visually stunning things, while impress is more about making a positive impact on someone.

Electrify.wordDefinition:
Electrify means to shock or excite someone with a sudden surge of energy or excitement. It is applicable in situations where you want to describe an intense and thrilling experience, such as a concert, a sports game, or a speech.

For example, "The audience was electrified by the rockstar's performance."

Enchant.wordDefinition:
Enchant means to charm or fascinate someone with something. It generates a feeling of magic or wonder in the person that is being enchanted.

For example, when you watch a magic show, you can become enchanted by the tricks.

In short, enchantment evokes a feeling of magic and fascination, while impressing generates a feeling of admiration and respect.

Enthuse.wordDefinition:
Enthuse means to express enthusiastic or eager enjoyment or approval, while impress means to make someone feel admiration and respect.

Enthuse is applicable when you want to convey your excitement or enthusiasm about something to others. For example, "I am really enthused about going to the concert tonight.".

quotes.Text: I collect art, and I drink wine... things that I like that I had never been exposed to. But I never said, 'I'm going to buy art to impress this crowd.' That's just ridiculous to me. I don't live my life like that, because how could you be happy with yourself?
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Jay-Z

quotes.Text: I played a little bit of 'City of Heroes' - they have a really great character generation system. I was pretty impressed with that. I played 'World of Warcraft' with my kids. That's a lot of fun.
quotes.Title: South Korean Artist
quotes.Name: Jim Lee

quotes.Text: He's not a coach who speaks to you every day. Wenger has spoken to me two or three times. He's told me he's very impressed by how I train and how I'm a disciplined character.
quotes.Title: Swiss Athlete
quotes.Name: Granit Xhaka

quotes.Text: I am deeply impressed with the gravity and wisdom with which most federal judges approach the responsibility of sentencing. It is a difficult, soul-searching task at best.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Robert Kennedy

quotes.Text: You know, when I have a bad game, it continues to humble me and know that, you know, you still have work to do and you still have a lot of people to impress.
quotes.Title: American Basketball Player
quotes.Name: LeBron James

quotes.Text: Having kids has been a turning point in my life because when I was still single, all I wanted was to impress beautiful girls.
quotes.Title: Indonesian Actor
quotes.Name: Joe Taslim

quotes.Text: Never try to impress a woman, because if you do she'll expect you to keep up the standard for the rest of your life.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: W. C. Fields

quotes.Text: If coming events are said to cast their shadows before, past events cannot fall to leave their impress behind them.
quotes.Title: Russian Author
quotes.Name: Helena Blavatsky

quotes.Text: The fool shouts loudly, thinking to impress the world.
quotes.Title: French Poet
quotes.Name: Marie de France

quotes.Text: I've never tried to impress anybody in my life.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Angad Bedi
